oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Antibiotic selection, use and residue avoidance: Things to consider
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Griffin, Dee
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: antibiotic
judicious
stewardship
pharmacodynamics
pharmacokinetic
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This document discusses the importance of connecting pharmacodynamic and pharmacokinetics in considerations when developing feeder and stocker cattle antibiotic treatment protocols. Simple illustrations of the use of the pharmacodynamic and pharmacokinetic link for commonly used FDA-approved antibiotics are explored. Additionally, important residue avoidance points to consider are discussed when using medication in feeder and stocker cattle with special emphasis on extra label drug use is employed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2020; 145-149
